title: Determine which object has a decreasing KE

content.question: An object is moving to the right with speed vi when a force of magnitude F is exerted on it. In which of the following situations is the objectâ€™s direction of motion changing and kinetic energy decreasing at the instant shown?

choices.label: Option A consists of an object and two directional arrows. The figure shows an object with a vertical arrow pointing up labeled F, and a horizontal arrow pointing right labeled v sub i to the right of the object.

Option B consists of an object and two directional arrows. The figure shows an object with a horizontal arrow pointing left labeled F, and a horizontal arrow pointing right labeled v sub i to the right of the object.

Option C consists of an object and two directional arrows. The figure shows an object with an arrow pointing up and to the right at a 45 degree angle labeled F, and a horizontal arrow pointing right labeled v sub i to the right of the object.

Option D consists of an object and two directional arrows. The figure shows an object with an arrow pointing up and to the left at a 45 degree angle labeled F, and a horizontal arrow pointing right labeled v sub i to the right of the object.

content.answer: Option D consists of an object and two directional arrows. The figure shows an object with an arrow pointing up and to the left at a 45 degree angle labeled F, and a horizontal arrow pointing right labeled v sub i to the right of the object.
